item.title: Asset System
item.description: Table of Contents Assets AssetLifetime AssetRegistry Cooking CookOnTheFly OfflineCooking Assets The Tempest engine, like most other engines out there, has a concept of an asset along with an asset manager that can handle asset lifetimes as well as asset cooking. The engine contains a base class that all asset types derive from. A simplified version of that Asset base class is below. struct AssetHandle { // This contains the unique path to the asset, stored as a string // and a hash value of that path evaluated at compile time using constexpr.

item.title: Tempest Engine
item.description: Table of Contents Introduction Why Build A New Engine Pros Cons Conclusion Introduction About two years ago I had started building a new engine in C++ with the initial intention of having some base framework I could experiment with and also challenging myself to build a proper game editor since I had yet to do that. I had built a few engines in the past but it was always with the intention of learning more things so I generally avoided using third party libraries.
